summary:
The Amazon rainforest is a huge tropical forest in South America, covering over 2.7 million square miles. It's known as Amazonia and is home to an incredible variety of plants and animals. Nine countries have land in this region, with Brazil having the largest part. Many different people live here, including indigenous groups.

Unfortunately, the Amazon is facing a big problem with deforestation, which is when trees are cut down, causing harm to the environment. This is a serious issue that needs attention to protect this important ecosystem.
title: Amazon rainforest
